author: fitz
msg: Incorporate a number of book changes.
Suggested by: Gareth McCaughan <Gareth.McCaughan@pobox.com>
* doc/book/book/ch03.xml: Changes to 'svn status', 'svn diff', and
'svn resolve'

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Allow compilation of SWIG Python bindings on platforms where Python has
threads and APR doesn't.
Based on conversations with Python experts (Thomas Wouters and Greg) at OSCON,
if we do nothing in the case where APR does not have threads (and isn't
thread-safe), Python will do the right thing because the global interpreter
lock will still be held and the Python interpreter will start to block - which
is correct.
* bindings/swig/swigutil_py.c (release_py_lock, acquire_py_lock):
Turn release_py_lock and acquire_py_lock into no-ops when we don't have
Python threads *and* APR threads.  Clarify comments to state what's going on.

author: fitz
msg: Book: add missing entries in the "svn Switches" section; fix
formatting.
Patch by: Julian Foad <julianfoad@btopenworld.com>
* doc/book/book/ch06.xml
Fix some formatting: use of "<option>".
* doc/book/book/ch08.xml
Add missing entries in the "svn Switches" section.
Fix some formatting, including missing white space.
Fix some text: "Addition"->"Deletion", a misplaced ")", etc.

author: mbk
msg: Check for errors during tunnel creation.  This is especially important for
non-Unix platforms; on Win32, missing tunnel-agents were causing indefinite
hangs.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_svn/client.c
(ra_svn_open): Add lots of apr status checking during tunnel-agent setup.

author: cmpilato
msg: Fix an inappropriate function name in update_tests.py.  This was fixed
by kfogel within a large change committed as r6173, but lost when that
change was reverted in r6177.
Patch by Julian Foad <julianfoad@btopenworld.com>.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/update_tests.py
(update_to_resolve_text_conflicts): Replaces update_to_revert_text_conflicts.
(test_list): Adjust.
